creator: tdawson@apache.org
text:
after upgrading to Ant 1.6 (b2 and b3) I'm getting an IO Error when running 
XDoclet (which uses javadoc)

[ejbdoclet] Javadoc execution
[ejbdoclet] Loading source file C:\Projects\notiva\cbo-
akron\core\src\com\notiva\core
[ejbdoclet] Loading source file C:\Projects\notiva\cbo-
akron\core\src\com\notiva\core
[ejbdoclet] Loading source file C:\Projects\notiva\cbo-
akron\core\src\com\notiva\core
[ejbdoclet] Loading source file C:\Projects\notiva\cbo-
akron\core\src\com\notiva\core
[ejbdoclet] Loading source file C:\Projects\notiva\cbo-
akron\core\src\com\notiva\core
[ejbdoclet] Loading source file C:\Projects\notiva\cbo-
akron\core\src\com\notiva\core
[ejbdoclet] Loading source file C:\Projects\notiva\cbo-
akron\core\src\com\notiva\core
[ejbdoclet] Loading source file C:\Projects\notiva\cbo-
akron\core\src\com\notiva\core
[ejbdoclet] Loading source file C:\Projects\notiva\cbo-
akron\core\src\com\notiva\core
[ejbdoclet] Loading source file C:\Projects\notiva\cbo-
akron\core\src\com\notiva\core
[ejbdoclet] Loading source file C:\Projects\notiva\cbo-
akron\core\src\com\notiva\core
[ejbdoclet] Constructing Javadoc information...
[ejbdoclet] Running XDoclet failed. An IO error occured while reading context 
data.

I wish I could provide more information, this was copied running with -v. 
reverting to 1.5.1 fixes the problem nicely. but I really want to use some of 
the new features of 1.6. ;-)

While certainly this points to there being some backwards compatibility issue with Ant, if you are 
using XDoclet 1.1 you are behind the times.  I cannot encourage you enough to upgrade to 
XDoclet 1.2, even if it is a beta version.... it is dramatically better and does work with Ant 1.6.
creator: jakarta@ehatchersolutions.com
antoine@apache.org
text:
Hi Tim,

can you find out with ant -verbose or ant -debug which exact command line is
used to invoke Javadoc, both in the case of ant 1.5.1 and ant 1.6b2 or b3.

Also, attaching a build file snippet and data with which the problem can be
reproduced, and the output of ant -verbose, would help us solve the problem.

Cheers,

Antoine

creator: alban.peignier@free.fr
text:
I have the same problem and this is a interesting stacktrace :

Running XDoclet failed. An IO error occured while reading context data.
[debug] IOException

        at xdoclet.DocletTask$DocletMain.start(DocletTask.java:529)

        at com.sun.tools.javadoc.DocletInvoker.invoke(DocletInvoker.java:193)

        at com.sun.tools.javadoc.Main.main(Main.java:233)

creator: alban.peignier@free.fr

text:
If Tim uses weblogic 6.1 like me .. the problem comes from the weblogic jar
file. It contains an Ant version 1.3 compiled on May 11 2001 (!!).. In this
version, the RuntimeConfigurable isn't serializable.

ejbdoclet works fine if the weblogic.jar is *after* the ant.jar in the doclet
classpath (I set the "build.sysclasspath" property to "first"). The weblogic jar
can be cleaned too.
creator: alban.peignier@free.fr

text:
Re: Erik Hatcher's suggestion to upgrade to XDoclet 1.2beta
one of my staff reported that our websphere descriptors no longer were 
generated correctly under that version of XDoclet and we have not had time to 
investigate further.

Re: Alban Peignier's suggestion re: weblogic.jar
we are using weblogic 8.1, but removing it from the classpath did not resolve 
the problem.
creator: tdawson@apache.org

creator: tdawson@apache.org
tdawson@apache.org
text:
d'oh. after posting that last note I noticed hidden in the verbose output that 
there's a copy of ant.jar sitting right on top of the doclet path. upon closer 
inspection it was a copy of Ant 1.5.1. Updating the jar file to the right 
version made the problem go away.

now I'm off to find out why we even had a copy of Ant.jar separate from 
$ANT_HOME/lib in the first place.

my apologies.

in retrospect, Alban Peignier's comments re: having another version of Ant in 
the classpath was dead-on even though I initially dismissed it after removing 
weblogic.jar from the classpath... Thanks Alban!

This might be worth an FAQ entry; I did a ton of looking around before 
creating the issue and didn't see anything.
creator: tdawson@apache.org
